reqs:
EOSC448 Directed Studies (Data analysis and Machine learning in EOAS):
This is an upper level course on applying machine learning and statistical methods to analyze big data in naturals sciences, with focus on applications in Earth Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences. Topics include regression and spectral analysis, multivariate statistical methods (principal component and canonical correlation analysis), classification and clustering methods, and neural network modeling. [3-0-0] The course is cross-listed with EOSC510.
For more info, please visit:
https://www.eoas.ubc.ca/academics/courses/eosc510
Prerequisites: 3rd year standing in Science, STATS 200, one of MATH 101 or MATH 102 or MATH 104; one of MATH 101 or MATH 103 or MATH 105. (In addition to these, for ENVR students only: ENVR300).
Beneficial but not required: a course in linear algebra (e.g. MATH 223), a course in vector calculus (e.g. MATH 200, EOSC 250), familiarity with basic programing (e.g. MATLAB, R, Python)
description: Investigation of a topic to be agreed upon by a member of the faculty and the student. Permission of an undergraduate advisor and of the supervising faculty member is required before registration.
